title: Wikiwand - Eliot Tokar
description: Eliot Tokar is an American practitioner of Tibetan medicine, author, and lecturer. He lives and works in New York City.
cleaned_text: / From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Dear Wikiwand AI, let's keep it short by simply answering these key questions: Can you list the top facts and stats about Eliot Tokar? Summarize this article for a 10 years old Eliot Tokar is an American practitioner of [Tibetan medicine](/en/Traditional_Tibetan_medicine), author, and lecturer. He lives and works in [New York City](/en/New_York_City). As one of the few Westerners to have apprenticed with Tibetan physicians, [[1]](#cite_note-1) Tokar studied with and received private instruction from Dr. [Yeshi Dhonden](/en/Yeshi_Dhonden), the former personal physician to [Tenzin Gyatso, the 14th Dalai Lama](/en/Tenzin_Gyatso,_the_14th_Dalai_Lama) of [Tibet](/en/Tibet), from 1983 to 1986. [[2]](#cite_note-2) After 1986, Tokar was an apprentice of the late lama and physician Dr. Trogawa Rinpoche, founder of the Chagpori Tibetan Medical Institute in [Darjeeling, India](/en/Darjeeling). [[3]](#cite_note-3) He has also studied with numerous other doctors including Shakya Dorje, Thubten Phuntsog and Kuzang Nyima. He also trained
